intro: Ternstroemia sylvatica, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Theaceae family, which includes camellias and azaleas. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically oval-shaped and have a smooth, glossy texture. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by bright red berries in the fall. Ternstroemia sylvatica thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
